"Lost" is a classic example of literature-based movies. The story revolves around a young man who decides to commit suicide when his life suddenly changes. As death starts kicking in, he flashes back to times in his life that cause him to want to live  -- is it too late? It's a story that captures the essence of life and its meaning. "The Narrows" is another classic example of literature-based movies. The movie revolves around a group of sailors who are on their way home from a long voyage. Other possible recommendations based on your preferences could include:

The journalists are sent into the bush, where they encounter local villagers, who are also fighting in the conflict. The journalists find themselves in this chaos and have to use their skills and knowledge to try to survive and make sense of what is happening around them.
